segment.source: Administering App-V 5.1 Virtual Applications by Using the Management Console
segment.target: Administering App-V 5.1 Virtual Applications by Using the Management Console

segment.source: Administering App-V 5.1 Virtual Applications by Using the Management Console
segment.target: Administering App-V 5.1 Virtual Applications by Using the Management Console

segment.source: Administering App-V 5.1 Virtual Applications by Using the Management Console
segment.target: Administering App-V 5.1 Virtual Applications by Using the Management Console

segment.source: Use the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.1 management server to manage packages, connection groups, and package access in your environment.
segment.target: Use the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.1 management server to manage packages, connection groups, and package access in your environment.

segment.source: The server publishes application icons, shortcuts, and file type associations to authorized computers that run the App-V 5.1 client.
segment.target: The server publishes application icons, shortcuts, and file type associations to authorized computers that run the App-V 5.1 client.

segment.source: One or more management servers typically share a common data store for configuration and package information.
segment.target: One or more management servers typically share a common data store for configuration and package information.

segment.source: The management server uses Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) groups to manage user authorization and has SQL Server installed to manage the database and data store.
segment.target: The management server uses Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) groups to manage user authorization and has SQL Server installed to manage the database and data store.

segment.source: Because the management servers stream applications to end users on demand, these servers are ideally suited for system configurations that have reliable, high-bandwidth LANs.
segment.target: Because the management servers stream applications to end users on demand, these servers are ideally suited for system configurations that have reliable, high-bandwidth LANs.

segment.source: The management server consists of the following components:
segment.target: The management server consists of the following components:

segment.source: Management Server – Use the management server to manage packages and connection groups.
segment.target: Management Server – Use the management server to manage packages and connection groups.

segment.source: Publishing Server – Use the publishing server to deploy packages to computers that run the App-V 5.1 client.
segment.target: Publishing Server – Use the publishing server to deploy packages to computers that run the App-V 5.1 client.

segment.source: Management Database - Use the management database to manage the package access and to publish the server’s synchronization with the management server.
segment.target: Management Database - Use the management database to manage the package access and to publish the server’s synchronization with the management server.

segment.target: Management Console tasks

segment.source: The most common tasks that you can perform with the App-V 5.1 Management console are:
segment.target: The most common tasks that you can perform with the App-V 5.1 Management console are:

segment.source: The main elements of the App-V 5.1 Management Console are:
segment.target: The main elements of the App-V 5.1 Management Console are:

segment.source: Management Console tab
segment.target: Management Console tab

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Packages tab
segment.target: Packages tab

segment.source: Use the PACKAGES tab to add or upgrade packages.
segment.target: Use the PACKAGES tab to add or upgrade packages.

segment.source: Connection Groups tab
segment.target: Connection Groups tab

segment.source: Use the CONNECTION GROUPS tab to manage connection groups.
segment.target: Use the CONNECTION GROUPS tab to manage connection groups.

segment.source: Servers tab
segment.target: Servers tab

segment.source: Use the SERVERS tab to register a new server.
segment.target: Use the SERVERS tab to register a new server.

segment.source: Administrators tab
segment.target: Administrators tab

segment.source: Use the ADMINISTRATORS tab to register, add, or remove administrators in your App-V 5.1 environment.
segment.target: Use the ADMINISTRATORS tab to register, add, or remove administrators in your App-V 5.1 environment.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: JavaScript must be enabled on the browser that opens the Web Management Console.
segment.target: JavaScript must be enabled on the browser that opens the Web Management Console.
